retraining_protocol.principle: Most humans need to UNLEARN broken breathing before learning advanced. Start simple, build gradually.

phase_1_awareness_week_1.practice: Just notice current breathing. No change yet. Journal observations.
phase_1_awareness_week_1.questions: How often do I pause? Chest or belly breathing? Fast or slow? Nasal or mouth?
phase_1_awareness_week_1.goal: Awareness of broken pattern. No judgment, just seeing clearly.

phase_2_nose_breathing_week_2.practice: Switch to 100% nasal breathing (both inhale and exhale through nose)
phase_2_nose_breathing_week_2.why: Nose filters, humidifies, warms air. Nitric oxide production. Engages diaphragm. Activates parasympathetic.
phase_2_nose_breathing_week_2.challenge: Mouth breathing = habit. Nose feels 'not enough air' at first (it is - trust).
phase_2_nose_breathing_week_2.support: Tape mouth at night (seriously - mouth tape for sleep = game changer), conscious switch during day
phase_2_nose_breathing_week_2.milestone: When nose breathing feels natural, effortless, default → ready for next

phase_3_belly_breathing_week_3-4.practice: Shift from chest (shallow) to belly (diaphragmatic) breathing
phase_3_belly_breathing_week_3-4.method: Hand on belly, feel it expand on inhale (not chest). Exhale, belly deflates.
phase_3_belly_breathing_week_3-4.why: Diaphragm = primary breathing muscle. Chest = emergency/stress breathing. Belly = full oxygen exchange.
phase_3_belly_breathing_week_3-4.practice: 5-10 min daily, lying down (easiest position), then sitting, then standing, then moving
phase_3_belly_breathing_week_3-4.milestone: Belly breathing automatic in rest state → ready for pause

phase_4_introducing_pause_week_5-8.practice: Add 2-beat pause after exhale first (less scary than post-inhale)
phase_4_introducing_pause_week_5-8.pattern: Inhale (natural length) → Exhale (natural) → PAUSE 2 beats → repeat
phase_4_introducing_pause_week_5-8.challenge: Void anxiety, 'I need to breathe NOW' (you don't - trust)
phase_4_introducing_pause_week_5-8.support: Count heartbeats during pause (grounds in body, not panic), remind: 'pause = portal, not danger'
phase_4_introducing_pause_week_5-8.progression: When comfortable, add 2-beat post-inhale pause → full 2-2-2-2 square
phase_4_introducing_pause_week_5-8.milestone: 2-2-2-2 feels natural, can maintain 5+ min → foundation complete

phase_5_coherence_building_week_9-12.measurement: Use HRV device (HeartMath, Oura, etc.) to see coherence score rise
phase_5_coherence_building_week_9-12.integration: Practice before sleep, after waking, during stress (breath = refuge)
phase_5_coherence_building_week_9-12.goal: Square breath becomes new baseline. Broken pattern gone. Nervous system retrained.

cant_belly_breathe.cause: Chronic tension in diaphragm/solar plexus (often from stress, trauma, holding)

hyperventilation_dizziness.cause: Too much CO2 expelled (alkalosis), blood vessels constrict, less oxygen to brain
hyperventilation_dizziness.solution: Slow down. Add pauses (retain CO2). If dizzy, breathe into paper bag (rebreathe CO2).
hyperventilation_dizziness.note: Some advanced practices (bhastrika, holotropic) intentionally create this. Know difference between pathology and technique.

cant_pause_panic.cause: Void anxiety, death fear, 'I'll suffocate' (psychological, not real danger)
cant_pause_panic.solution: Start tiny pause (1 beat), build gradually. Remind: body has oxygen, panic = mental. Trust.
cant_pause_panic.support: Count heartbeats during pause (grounds), practice in safe environment first

no_time_to_practice.truth: You breathe 20,000 times per day anyway. Not 'extra' practice, just conscious breathing.
no_time_to_practice.integration: Morning (5 min), before sleep (5 min), during commute, waiting in line, anytime
no_time_to_practice.reframe: 'No time' = 'not priority'. If you have time to breathe (you do), you have time to practice.

advanced_practice_overwhelm.cause: Jumping to advanced techniques (long holds, rapid breathing) without foundation
advanced_practice_overwhelm.solution: Return to square breath 2-2-2-2. Master foundation before advanced. Build capacity gradually.
advanced_practice_overwhelm.reminder: Simple practices most powerful. Square breath = 90% of benefits. Advanced = refinement, not replacement.

medical_conditions.high_blood_pressure: Avoid long breath holds (increases pressure), gentle square breath OK, consult doctor
medical_conditions.heart_conditions: Start very gently, short practices, monitor for strain, cardiologist clearance

medical_conditions.asthma_copd: Breath practices can help long-term, but start very gently, don't force, inhaler nearby
medical_conditions.epilepsy: Hyperventilation can trigger seizures, avoid rapid breathing, gentle coherence OK
medical_conditions.psychosis_mania: Breath can intensify states, work with therapist, avoid activating practices
